The meeting room:

The room that HYDRAS and CRYOTEK entered was not overly large but it
was well appointed. The room was dominated by a large table that ran
down the length of most of the room. At the head of the table was a
large chair for HYDRAS and at the other end of the table was a view
screen for any images that HYDRAS might deem fit to have displayed.
Along the rest of the table there were chairs positioned around
strategically around it at different points to ensure that everyone
had a seat.

There were windows looking to the outside of the ship as well, showing
a bit of the exterior and giving a magnificent view of the surround
area. This room is what might be called the captain's ready room had
the ship actually been in flight, and it was a room that could easily
serve as a meeting room for HYDRAS.

Already in the room FRACTYL was looking over some notes that he had,
he looked up as HYDRAS entered followed by CROTEK and of course by the
ever present INFERNO, and then lastly by SCOURGE.

"Hydras." SCOURGE said, "The preliminary report from the sweeps are
telling me that as far as the optic can determine is that they are at
the edge of a large jungle, one that spreads for miles. There is
nothing strange about the rocks and trees and such but there is some
sort of energy coming from it."

SCOURGE cocked his head as if he was not sure how to explain the next
part, "From what the sweeps are telling me, it reminds them a little
of Unicron, but it is different. They can't explain it." He grunted as
they told him more. "They have flown around and from what they can see
the energy is cutting off all communications, all video, audio, every
kind of transmission that they know of."

FRACTYL was listening with great interest as SCOURGE talked he making
notes on his PADD as well. "I think I miht have a map of that." He
said. "I have made a few surveys of the area in question from a few
years ago."

He reached over and pressed a few buttons and an image appeared on the
screen. The image on the viewscreen was indeed that of a large and
dense jungle, one that covers a large area.

"This -Rainforest-" FRACTYL said, stressing the words 'Rain Forest as
a correction to SCOURGE, "for it is more than a simple Jungle
encompasses an area of approximately 10,500 square kilometers of
rolling and uneven terrain."

FRACTYL turned to look at HYDRAS, "Although at that time there was no
indication of the energies that the sweeps are reporting."

(TAG)

Preston
